refnamediv.refpurpose: Returns portion of dotted name such as a fully qualified table name.

refsect1.title: Description
refsect1.para: The name_part() can be used to dissecting parts of a three part names (string where items are divided by dots ".") such as table names or columns names. The table name "DB"."DBA"."SYS_USERS" contains three parts which can be extracted individually using this function providing the correct index from a 0 base: 0 would return "DB", 1 would return "DBA", 2 would return "SYS_USERS".

refsect2.title: dstring
refsect2.para: The default value if the found value is null.

refsect1.title: Return Types
refsect1.para: A string will be returned containing the text from the specified index.

entry.errorname: Function name_part needs a string as argument 1, not an arg of type [type]
Function name_part needs an integer as argument 2, not an arg of type [type]

example.title: Using the name_part() function
example.para: This simple example shows the 3 parts of a table name being retrieved using the name_part() function from ISQL.
example.screen:
SQL> select name_part('"DB"."DBA"."SYS_TABLES"', 0); callret VARCHAR __________________________________________________________
"DB"
1 Rows. -- 20 msec. SQL> select name_part('"DB"."DBA"."SYS_TABLES"', 1); callret VARCHAR __________________________________________________________
"DBA"
1 Rows. -- 30 msec. SQL> select name_part('"DB"."DBA"."SYS_TABLES"', 2); callret VARCHAR __________________________________________________________
SYS_TABLES"
1 Rows. -- 20 msec.
